title: What's the most hated Beatles song? - Quora

response.answer_text: I doubt there is a Beatles song that is widely ‘hated’. As already stated, hate is a powerful emotion and is perhaps the wrong choice of word. However, one song that went close with me when it was released was The Ballad of John and Yoko. It was more the title of the song. I thought WTF, but this is The Beatles! At the time I felt angry because Yoko’s infestation of The Beatles had led to an almost sacrilegious like bastardisation of their specialness. She was the intruder whose presence had gone much too far. And like others I thought she had brainwashed John. Ironically, I now rather enjoy the lyrics because they provide a nostalgic reminder of a very special era. But the title still enrages me at times.

“Hated” is a very strong word about something as insignificant as a song! There are a bunch of songs that a lot of Beatles “fans” really don’t like but Hated? No. If you hate a song that a bit extreme. Tracks that a majority of Beatles fans don’t like include “Revolution 9“, “Mr Moonlight” , “Maxwell’s Silver Hammer” and “Wild Honey Pie”, but even then there will be someone who likes the track. But “hated?” no!. I’m sorry but if someone has a track that they “hate” then they really should get a life! If you dislike the track so much then do as I do. Press the skip button!
